program.q1: Do you want to be part of tech-solutions for and national challenges in the educational area?
program.q2: Do you have a problem in education that could be solved with the support of technology?
program.whatKind: What kind of problem we are aiming to solve?

program.title: The program
program.description: The Edtech Hackathon is an event to develop tech solutions to local and global challenges in education. The online phase is the moment where everyone can submit an idea of challenge here. The presencial phase, which will take place on the 22-24th of August at the Goethe Institut in São Paulo. It will be two exclusive days for participants to develop solutions supported by mentors and workshops and pizza.

challenges.title: The Challenges
challenges.description: Challenges related to education and technology can be submitted online and by everyone, some will be selected by jury and will be worked on by hackthon participants over two days. The solutions proposed during the Hackthon will be sent to the authors and published here.

participants.title: Participants
participants.description: The participants from various regions of Brazil will be selected by the organizing committee. We will financially support applications from outside the expanded São Paulo area and from all over Brazil with a mobility grant.

pocketevent.title: Pre-Event | Digital Education
pocketevent.description:
This pre-event webinar will showcase the state of the art of digitalization in Education from the perspective of the two German Universities and will also explain the hackathon idea and inform about the program and the ways to participate.
Program (local Brazilian CET time): 10am (Brazilian time) / 15 hours (CEST)
10:00 AM (BRT) | Welcome & Opening Remarks
Welcome & Moderation: Sören Metz (Technical University of Munich) and Christian Lazar (Freie Universität Berlin)
10:15 (BRT) | Digital Education - Quo vadis. Insights from two German universities of Excellence
- Prof. Dr. Daniel Pittich (Assitant Professorship of Technical Education - TUM)
- Dr. Antje Brock (Institut Futur, Freie Universität Berlin)
10:45 (BRT) | German-Brazilian EdTech Hackathon
- Thomas Bartoschek (re:edu) - presentation of the challenge and the German-Brazilian EdTech Hackathon
11:00 AM (BRT) | Q&A Session with all panelists

11:30 AM (BRT) | Wrap-Up
Closing Remarks, Summary and Wrap Up

The webinar will be conducted in English. Questions can be asked by the audience in the webinar

jury.title: The Jury
jury.prizesdescription: The best team will be awarded with a registration for one representative of the winning team to participate in the German-Brazilian Innovation and Sustainability Congress organized by the German-Brazilian Chamber of Commerce and Industry São Paulo (AHK-SP), to be held on 29 and 30 September in São Paulo. The decision will be made by a high-ranking jury according to the following criteria:
jury.description: General description and the number of people

mentors.title: The Mentors and Mediators
mentors.description: The Team of mentors will help you during the hackathon. They are experts in different fields and they will be available during the hackathon

pocketevent.title: Webinar
pocketevent.content: Get to know the state of the art of digitalization in Education with German Universities and Hackathon idea.
